0.Cons: Over worked and under paid no team work

1.Pros: Free Food, Meet People of Similar Age

2.Pros: No experience needed, Gain experience dealing with difficult customers.

3.Pros: Great work experience, family friendly environment Definitely works with your schedule if you have school, or do sports.
3.Cons: Depending on your location you can really enjoy your job or dread it, however it's not a bad company to get involved with.

4.Pros: The hours I worked were very flexible. A great first job to gain customer service experience for you to add on your resume
4.Cons: There are only two things I can think of. The isn't the best and you go home smelling like fast food

5.Pros: -a team-like atmosphere as in that's how it should be to be the most efficient and customer - pleasing, but unfortunately I ended up doing a good portion of the work myself
5.Cons: -Unprofessional boss-dramatic, unprofessional, immature employees-terrible conditions for food prep (roaches, during cricket season crickets fell in the grease and upon my inquiry as to whether or not we could change the grease, I was told the hot temperature would sanitize it from the cricket germs) that I'm sure customers would be appalled to find out-not paid according to the workload you take on--basically, when you do all the work to at least try and make the customers happy, you get taken advantage of to work more hours than your schedule allows-your schedule and needs as an employee are not taken into account-some managers are rude to employees so much that customers call the main office and complain about treatment of employees-immature employees walk out of work, leaving the few good employees to handle the fast-paced busy environment extremely short-handed-schedule/shift is made extremely short-handed to meet labor and this makes customers unhappy with the slow service and indecent food-higher-ups in the company ask you to change your hours as a floor supervisor or you'll be demoted (a floor supervisor is a position with limited availability)-basically no interview, application isn't even viewed which means consistently bad hires and no prior knowledge of the good hires-made to clean for days before a health inspection instead of just keeping clean operation at all times-anyone is promoted, meaning incompetent, immature, careless management for the most part

6.Pros: Free meal a day, (consisting of an entrée a side and a drink or dessert), half off food in your off time, McDonald's discount program with partnering companies, very flexible hours
6.Cons: You have to be good at multitasking, and good with people, not expect too many hours and have an open mind, you deal with many people from many different backgrounds

7.Pros: Free Food, and it was really good
7.Cons: People were mean working there mostly

8.Pros: Work with nice peopleFast pace never boredGiod pay
8.Cons: Long hoursCustomers can be a hassleNot a lot of time to yourself

9.Cons: High-intensity work with very little pay.
